intro: Isolepis, commonly known as spikegrass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cyperaceae. These plants are typically found in wetland environments, including marshes, bogs, and along the edges of ponds. They are characterized by their dense, grass-like foliage and spike-like inflorescences. Isolepis species often have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, inconspicuous flowers. They play an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
